sections.name: Melianse
sections.html: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Aquatic
traits.text: Aquatic creatures are at home underwater. Their bludgeoning and slashing unarmed Strikes don’t take the usual –2 penalty for being underwater. Aquatic creatures can breathe water but not air.

traits.name: Fey
traits.text: Creatures of the First World are called the fey.

interaction_abilities.name: Wild Empathy
interaction_abilities.text: Melianse can use Diplomacy to Make an Impression on aquatic or amphibiousanimals and make very simple Requests of them.

modifiers.name: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still use your Strength modifier when calculating damage.

ability.name: Grant Desire

traits.name: Divination
traits.text: The divination school of magic typically involves obtaining or transferring information, or predicting events.

traits.name: Primal
traits.text: This magic comes from the primal tradition, connecting to the natural world and instinct. Anything with this trait is magical.

ability.effect: Melianse can duplicate any 3rd-level spell or produce any effect with a power level in line with a 3rd-level spell, but only in response to the request or desire of a non-fey creature. The creature whose desire is granted can never again benefit from Melianse's Grant Desire ability
